results.title: Slips,Trips and Falls
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safetycare”.
Along with manual handling, slips, trips, and falls are the cause of a majority of accidents in the workplace. This video covers everything from the ground up…leads on the floors, objects such as books and briefcases, slippery surfaces through to filing cabinets and reaching too far, taking short cuts and general good housekeeping practices.

results.title: Portable fire extinguishers
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safetycare”.
Looks at firefighting techniques of starvation, smothering, cooling and stopping the chemical chain reaction; extinguishing agents such as water, foam, carbon dioxide and dry powder; fire extinguishers for ordinary combustibles, flammable and combustible liquids, flammable gases, combustible metals, electrically energised equipment and cooking oils & fats; classifications of fires and the operation of fire extinguishers. The main aim of this package is to provide the facilitator with discussion points important to the overall development of the program and to allow participants the opportunity of discussing the impact the program may have on current work practices and whether in fact changes may be required. Included is a Trainer’s Manual.

results.title: Lifting and carrying
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safetycare”.
Despite rapid and continued advances in mechanisation methods, it will always remain impossible to eliminate physical involvement within the working environment. Material handling occurs in one way or another in every department of every business on every working day, so it is not surprising that accidents resulting from incorrect handling techniques comprise nearly 30% of occupational injuries, with the most common injury being back pain. This video and trainer’s manual highlights the construction of the spine and its limitations and clearly illustrates how and why injuries will occur if we do not respect the limitations and use correct lifting and carrying techniques.

results.title: Lifting and Carrying
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safetycare”.
The correct techniques and an understanding of the principles of safe lifting is essential knowledge. This video examines the correct procedures for different types of objects and underlines the principles of safe lifting techniques.

results.title: Identifying Fire Hazards
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safetycare”.
Identifying potential fire hazards is an extension of a basic good housekeeping policy - preventing fires by identifying and removing potential fire hazards should be regular practice in all workplaces. This video tells what to look for to make sure safety precautions such as fire doors are functioning properly and will serve their intended purpose in an emergency. Sprinklers, safe storage, controlling incoming goods, proper ventilation are some of the points.

results.title: Hand tools
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safetycare”.
This program demonstrates the correct usage of basic handtools and the safety procedures to remember when working with these tools. Discusses spanners, wrenches, pliers, hammers and hacksaws, showing the correct use and maintenance for maximum working condition.
